sen.e: It is said that the Kokubun clan (in Mutsu Province) was samurai who had possessed the southern part of Miyagi County, Mutsu Province from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts to the Sengoku period (the period of warring states), and this clan originated from Tanemichi, who took his family name from Kokubun in Shimousa Province and relocated to Kokubun in Miyagi County given as reward grants for the Battle of Oshu.

sen.j: 系図作者が陸奥の国分氏を鎌倉御家人の国分胤通に結びつけたのではないかとみる説からすれば、胤茂は系図をつなぐために作られた人物ということになる。
sen.e: If the drawer of the family tree associated the Kokubun clan in Mutsu with Tanemichi KOKUBUN who was Kamakura gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura), Tanemochi is an imaginary figure created for smooth linkage of the family tree.
